project.teaser: STAR4BBS is a three-year multidisciplinary and multi-actor collaborative project, involving seven partners, three associated partners and one linked third party. The overall aim of STAR4BBS is to maximize the potential of Sustainability Certification Schemes (SCS) and labels...
project.objective: STAR4BBS is a three-year multidisciplinary and multi-actor collaborative project, involving seven partners, three associated partners and one linked third party. The overall aim of STAR4BBS is to maximize the potential of Sustainability Certification Schemes (SCS) and labels to support a successful transition to sustainable bio-based economy. At the core of the STAR4BBS project is the development of indicators and a new monitoring system for assessing the effectiveness and robustness of existing international and EU SCS, B2B labels, and related traceability systems applicable to biological feedstock and bio-based materials and products. This information will create the foundations to support achieving the much needed harmonization between schemes and transparency in global and EU trade flows. Through the developed new monitoring system, existing SCS and labels will be analyzed, and the results, as well as additional research on certified and uncertified trade flows and on the impacts and costs and benefits of certification and labels, will substantially increase understanding of the potential of these schemes to contribute to policy and industry sustainability goals and will build awareness of the differences between the schemes. The project will involve important stakeholders (including scheme owners, policy makers, and industry) in the design of research and the monitoring system and in the development of practical recommendations emerging from the research and analysis in order to ensure that the project achieves its ultimate goal. In particular, an increased uptake of the most effective SCS and labels by the bio-based industry will support the development of circular, climate-neutral, sustainable biobased systems that will mitigate climate change, increase resource efficiency, preserve and restore ecosystems, biodiversity, natural resources, and the quality of air, water and soil.
project.title: Sustainability Transition Assessment Rules for Bio-Based Systems

result.description: This deliverable provides the overview of all the management activities that will be put in place in order to assure the quality of all the results (deliverables) and the timely execution from all beneficiaries. This deliverable is linked to T8.1.

result.title: Report on matching biogenic flows with certification systems
result.description: In order to get an overview of the proportion of certified and non-certified bio-based feedstocks and products in Europe, Deliverable D2.3 combines the identified biogenic flows of Task 2.1 with the SCS results from Task 1.2 and 1.3. In addition, the impact of the SCS on market access and trade of bio-based raw materials and products is evaluated and the extent to which sustainability certification could be a plus or a hindrance is assessed.

result.title: STAR4BBS final conference Report
result.description: This deliverable shows briefly all the information related to the organisation of the final event, the programme, the participants, the outreach activities and the main results. This deliverable is linked to Task 7.5.

result.title: Final Data Management Plan
result.description: The Final DMP will be developed following the recommendation provided by the EC and will include information on: (i) what data has been collected, processed and/or generated; (ii) which methodology and standards were applied; (iii) whether data was shared/made open access; and (iv) how data was handled and preserved (including after the end of the project).This deliverable is linked to T8.2.

result.title: Report on sustainability indicators for the monitoring system based on Life Cycle assessment
result.description: Identification of indicators based on the Life Cycle approach to be included in the monitoring system. The selected indicators will cover environmental, social and economic aspects and will consider feedstock and materials/products specificities.

result.title: Roadmap for STAR4BBS' outputs exploitation
result.description: This deliverable will provide an overview of the work that will be conducted within Task 7.4. Specifically, it will include actions to ensure access to project’s results also after the end of the project, as well as approaches and procedures to further adopt and replicate the STAR4BBS monitoring system.

result.title: Report on impact and contribution of existing SCS and B2B labels
result.description: This public report will provide an overview of the work that will be conducted within Task 1.4. Specifically, it will present findings obtained by identifying relevant literature regarding the impact and contribution of the SCS and B2B labels to enabling responsible production, consumption and trade, in bio-based industries. This will be done through a systematic mapping exercise, following rigorous search protocols and covering many scientific and grey literature databases.

result.description: Identification of additional indicators based on different methodological approaches, aside from Life Cycle, and the applicable EU legislation identified in previous tasks. The specificities of feedstocks and materials/products will be considered.

result.title: Concept and methodology for collecting volumes of biogenic feedstock
result.description: Deliverable D2.1 describes the concept and the methodology for conducting the traceability of biological feedstock on a B2B level.

result.title: STAR4BBI stakeholder map

result.description: Based on the results of the previous work packages WP1-5, Deliverable D6.3 develops a recommendation letter that provides practical knowledge about certification systems to companies, policy makers and governments as wells as other target groups collaborating for the harmonization across schemes and labels.

result.title: Sustainability requirements for the monitoring system
result.description: This short report will provide an overview of the selected minimum sustainability requirements for the new developed monitoring system.

result.title: First Policy Brief
result.description: "This deliverable consists of a 2-3 pages ""joint policy brief”, which incorporates the midterms results and findings of the three projects selected under HORIZON-CL6-2021-ZEROPOLLUTION-01-07. In particular, this policy brief will focus on providing evidence for EU policy development, deriving from the first half of implementation period of the three projects."

result.title: Concept of the monitoring system
result.description: Thie report will provide a concept for the monitoring system. It will inlcude the results of a co-creation workshop and analysis with initial decisions about how the monitoring system will be structured, what content it will cover, and what kind of final ranking or result it will produce. This report will then form the basis of the further testing and design of the monitoring system.

result.description: STAR4BBS dissemination, exploitation and communication Plan (DECP) will define actions to be implement detailing target groups, key messages, channels, indicators and events. This deliverable is linked to T7.1.

result.title: Report on metrics, thresholds and minimum requirements for sustainability indicators
result.description: Report on metrics and threshold values for the identified indicators and first proposal of minimum sustainability requirements for the monitoring system.

result.title: Report on existing monitoring schemes, with recommendations for new system
result.description: This report provides an overview of existing monitoring schemes, for assessing the effectiveness of B2B labels and Certificaiton schemes. It will also provide recommendations on importnat features to be included in a new monitoring system.

result.title: Ethical issues report
result.description: This report describes the compliance of the project and related activities to ethical principles. This deliverable is linked to T8.2.

result.title: Advancing the European energy transition based on environmental, economic and social justice

details.authors: Arias, A., Feijoo, G., Moreira, MT.

result.title: Final Policy Brief
result.description: "This deliverable consists of a 2-3 pages ""joint policy brief”, which incorporates the final results and findings of the three projects selected under HORIZON-CL6-2021-ZEROPOLLUTION-01-07. In particular, this policy brief will focus on providing evidence for EU policy development, deriving from the second half of implementation period of the three projects."

result.title: Report on existing international and EU SCS and B2B labels for feedstock and bio-based materials & products
result.description: This public report will provide an overview of the work that will be conducted within Tasks 1.2 and 1.3. Specifically, it will present findings obtained by reviewing and analysing existing international and EU SCS and B2B labels for feedstock and bio-based materials & products. The review will focus on peer-reviewed papers and reports from the grey literature, databases, and EU as well as international web sources.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
